description: Cupcakes with different toppers as 'sprinkles'. Pretty sweet, no?
Those who know me, know I love penguins! Similar to my last entry, I created these penguin nails with different toppers as 'feathers'.
These nails are no dino-snore! For the #holotacovideogamenailart competition I free-handed Yoshi over Twinkled T's Icing 'Aurora' powder.
As soon as I saw the Holo Taco Rainbow Collection I knew that I had to recreate the 7-colour gradient. And for fun I added some stickers!
A gold and purple #HoloTacoCombo with matching striping tape.
I swear, Play Rosé works for any season! Here I created a simple fall look with Twinkled T's leaves nail vinyl on my accent nail.

Happy 'Holo'days! These Star Dust flakies from Twinkled T were the gift that kept on giving this year. WOW!! By the way, I created the bow by looping pieces of striping tape together and joining them in the middle.
Nothing says 'Ho Ho Ho!' more than these nail vinyls from Twinkled T. Complete with gold stones for holly berries. Merry Christmas y'all!
An almost negative space look with striping tape— 'almost' because I could not resist adding a unicorn skin over the naked nail!
Happy Valentine's Day! This was my first time playing with spider gels, and I am in LOVE. So much so, I added hearts. And rhinestones. You get the picture!
Pastels? For spring? Groundbreaking, I know! To shake things up a bit, I made each nail a dotticure with a matching linear holographic colour.

To create these tie-dye accent nails, I sponged on the cremes from Holo Taco's Unicorn Dream Collection in a random pattern. I then applied the Spot It top coat (when the nails were dry, oops!), giving a muted effect. Despite this mistake, I'm not mad at the way they turned out!
I was inspired by the Kelli Marissa x ORLY trio to create my very own galaxy manicure. To top off these polishes, I stamped various designs from her MoYou London collaboration plate.
To celebrate Holo Taco's 2nd Anniversary (and my birthday too!), I sponged on some holo flakie balloons with matching diamond shaped charms. I then 'baked' up a cake to complete the look.
